text: The Embassy of the United Kingdom in Stockholm is the chief diplomatic mission of the United Kingdom in Sweden. The Embassy also represents the British Overseas Territories in Sweden. It is located on Skarpögatan in the Diplomatstaden neighbourhood. The current British Ambassador to Sweden is David Cairns. ==History== Great Britain established a diplomatic mission in Stockholm in 1720. The current embassy building located at Skarpögatan 6-8, was opened in 1967 and was designed by the architect William S. Bryant. The British Ambassador's residence, which was built between 1914 and 1915 and was designed by Richard Allison, is located in the same area as the embassy, at Laboratoriegatan 8. Until 1939 it also served as the British Embassy. ;Gallery File:Lillienhoffska palatset 2010.jpg|Lillienhoff Palace, British Embassy 1723-unknown File:Diplomatstaden 2008 Dipl 1.jpg|Current British Ambassador's residence and previously British Embassy 1915-1939 File:Diplomatstaden 2008 Amb 5.jpg|British Embassy, 1939-1967 File:Storbritanniens ambassad 2008.jpg|British Embassy, 1967-present ==See also== *List of diplomatic missions in Sweden *List of ambassadors of the United Kingdom to Sweden ==References== Stockholm United Kingdom Category:Buildings and structures in Stockholm Category:Sweden–United Kingdom relations
title: Embassy of the United Kingdom, Stockholm
